intro: Lobelia breynii var. bragae, commonly known as the Cape lobelia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal regions and has adapted to tolerate salt spray and wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, particularly in coastal areas where it adds color and texture to the landscape.
